test_endpoint.title: Warhammer 40K: Darktide Prepares To Roll Out MS Store/Steam Crossplay In Next Update
test_endpoint.short_description: Players on Steam and the MS Store will be able to play together.
test_endpoint.article_content:
At the end of June - early July Warhammer 40K: Darktide will be rolling out update 1.1.10 which will bring crossplay between Steam and the Microsoft store. Players on Steam and the MS store will be able to add friends, matchmaking, and join players of the shooter from the other platforms. As of right now, players will not be able to move their progress from one platform to another, move their DLCs from one platform to another, or move their Aquilas from one platform to another. Players will also not have the ability to opt out of cross-platform play.

Along with cross-platform play comes balance chances to a few blessings, and a new condition called "Elite Resistance" which will spawn fewer but thougher enemies. Thronesode missions will also be affected by the Power Supply Interruption condition once the update goes live in Warhammer 40K: Darktide.

The devs also state that they are still hard at work on the Xbox release of Warhammer 40K: Darktide.

You can check out the full Warhammer 40K: Darktide Comm-Link post on the official Steam page.

test_endpoint.title: New World Lets You Summon Your On Sandwurm With New Heartrune Coming With Blood And Sand Update
test_endpoint.short_description: Unleash a Sandwurm Devourer on your enemies.
test_endpoint.article_content:
The Devourer Heartrune will be releasing with the Blood and Sand update for New World on July 6th, and with it you'll be able to unleash your very own Sandwurm on your enemies in the MMORPG.

In the latest Steam blog post for New World, the devs tell a pretty funny story about the first iteration of the Devourer Heartrune in which, during testing, they were using the wiggle dance animation as the summon animation for the Sandwurm.

“During early prototyping we used emotes as animations to set up the ability. There was a point in time where the pose to summon it used the “Wiggle Dance” emote, and although it looked kind of ridiculous, I will always love the concept of doing a little wiggly dance to summon the Devourer.” 

The new Devourer Heartrune in New World has two parts, an initial knockback as it emerges, and a follow-up chomp.

"Most of the time, targets will get knocked outside of the radius of the follow-up attack by the first hit. But those that Grit through that first attack, or avoid it via other mechanisms, will take a bigger chunk of damage,” said Combat Designer Josh Hurley.

While we're talking New World, Wave 2.2 of the PTR patch notes are up on Steam as well. Umbral Shard rewards for the Sandwurm encounter have been increased, improvements to the Hadish Azar seasonal encounter have been made, and there are plenty of other small tweaks. Check them out by following the link above.

test_endpoint.title: Post Gamigo Split, Fractured Online Announces Limited-Time Relaunch Pre-Test
test_endpoint.short_description: The test is open to all backers.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Fractured Online is on its way back, believe it or not given the MMORPG's checkered past and spilt from gamigo. But first, a test period.

On June 22 at 4:00 pm CEST, Dynamight Studios will be welcoming everyone who owns a Founder's Pack to test out the game. Those who purchased the game on Steam or Glyph are invited – provided they complete the data transfer.

The purpose of the test is to get feedback on new features added to the game since players were last able to access it. This includes a character progression revamp and a crafting revamp. A journey system has been introduced as has an ability level-up. The continent of Myr has been removed – apparently because it was “visually unappealing, repetitive, hard to cross” and other things.

Once the test is done and they’ve reviewed everything – and it’s all good – the game will be back. No more wipes will take place after that point. If you’re wondering about Steam… they’re not certain about that yet.

test_endpoint.title: Broken Ranks To Share Plans For The Future During TaernCon 2023
test_endpoint.short_description: A celebration of community is upon us.
test_endpoint.article_content:
On July 1st Whitemoon Games will be celebrating TaernCon in Wroclaw, Poland. With that comes plenty of community building and plans for the future of the MMORPG Broken Ranks.

Whitemoon Games has confirmed that this year's TaernCon will feature a PvP tournament, Q&A session, trivia, a cosplay contest, and a presentation about future plans of the studio including Broken Ranks.

“Once a year, the world of Broken Ranks melds with reality and we try to make it the best possible experience for everyone. During the event, even players from opposing factions have fun like best friends. They can see with their own eyes that the characters they have been meeting inside the game are not only a bunch of pixels, but real, nice people. In addition to that, they can talk to us, make suggestions, give feedback, celebrate, and drink to the well-being of the world they have spent so much time in. Thank you for being with us!” says Krzysztof Danilewicz, founder of Whitemoon Games. 

After the event, the studio's social media channels will be sharing photos and videos of the event for those who can't attend. Moreso, they've put together a video clip of past events to give players of Broken Ranks a taste of what they have to look forward to this year.

test_endpoint.title: 13 New Expeditions Hit GTFO And You'll Be Going DEEP Underground This Time Around
test_endpoint.short_description: Horror game GTFO get its biggest update to date.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Fans of 10 Chambers’ horror game GTFO might be excited to know that the game is getting a really big update. Named ALT://Rundow 5.0 – Rebirth, the update will introduce 13 new expeditions to the game, bringing the total count to 58.

This new update takes players deep underground, where they will confront a new monster lurking in the dark… possibly the first of many. While exploring the complex, players will have the opportunity to discover records about their past and uncover more about who they are and why they’re there.

In addition to announcing the new update, the developer also announced that GTFO will be on sale in just a few days, June 19 to be exact. Anyone who’d like to get the game will be able to grab it for 33% off.

test_endpoint.title: Is It An MMO? #10 — Throne And Liberty May Say It's An MMO, But It's Just A Mobile Game On PC
test_endpoint.short_description: Astral Hunting is the worst feature to ever exist in a game.
test_endpoint.article_content:
The characterization of a massively multiplayer online game, or MMO, is self-explanatory. Or is it? By definition, it means a large number of players on the same server — hundreds, thousands — and a big open world that continues to evolve. So does Throne and Liberty, the upcoming MMORPG developed by NCSoft for PC and mobile platforms, cut the mustard?

Yes. The game is obviously an MMO. No argument there. But we’re actually here to talk about something else. In this series, we look at games that teeter between falling into the not-so-cut-and-dried MMO category and the run-of-the-mill multiplayer genre. Why? Because the term “MMO” means both everything and nothing in the gaming industry today. We’re trying to make sense of that phrase we all know and love (or hate). Most of the time it comes down to numbers — the amount of people that can play together — yet sometimes an MMO doesn’t feel like an MMO…or, on the flipside, sometimes a non-MMO does feel like an MMO.

Throne and Liberty made waves when it was first revealed, but the game has received negative feedback following its beta test. Despite looking amazing, players have criticized Throne and Liberty for its tab-target combat system, which feels outdated compared to modern MMOs. This disappointment stems from the initial expectation of a fast-paced and dynamic action game. However, let’s put aside this complaint.

What I want to talk about is “Astral Hunting,” Throne and Liberty’s autoplay system. This functionality allows players to perform actions without having to do so manually. Simply put, the game plays itself for you from a grinding perspective. Now, this feature is not new. In fact, Black Desert Online has included something like it for years now. In that game, you can make your character fish while you go AFK. There’s also autopathing — where your character travels to a waypoint selected on the map, and autolooping — which is the same thing but with a return point, letting the character traverse back and forth indefinitely. Black Desert Online even takes things a step further in its mobile version by letting players autohunt, grinding levels by killing mobs without having to lift a finger or even be on your phone.

The thing is though, do people really consider Black Desert Mobile a true MMO? In my opinion, it’s just another mobile game, like Candy Crush. So when you put an autoplay feature in an MMO that goes beyond fishing or pathing, are the developers really doing the PC players any favors? Or are they just catering to the mobile folks? Because, in case you weren’t aware, mobile gaming dominates the gaming market, accounting for 61% of overall revenue and surpassing PC (and console) gaming. And that gap is only widening as the years go on.

Let’s bring it back now. Astral Hunting in Throne and Liberty lets players autohunt just like in Black Desert Mobile, but on PC too. They can enter “auto-combat” and just sit at their computer with their feet up watching their character fight enemies. It doesn’t stop there though, because the game allows auto-combat while offline for up to 8 hours a day, too. How, you might ask? Well, through the purchase of the battle pass, of course. Now, you can argue this system isn’t unfair, nor pay-to-win, since there’s no advantage besides saving time. But let’s be real, Astral Hunting completely undermines the fundamental principles of the MMORPG experience. Throne and Liberty may be an MMO by definition, but practically it’s just going to be a mobile game that’s accessible via PC.

test_endpoint.title: Undawn, The F2P Survival Game Featuring Will Smith, Is Now Available
test_endpoint.short_description: Let Will guide you on your journey.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Today, Level Infinite and LightSpeed Studios announced the launch of the open-world survival RPG Undawn. Designed primarily for mobile devices, the game also launched with a “PC companion version”. This can be picked up via Steam or the game’s official site.

A defining feature of Undawn is the inclusion of Will Smith as the NPC Trey Jones. Jones serves as a guide for players, helping them navigate the world. As with most survival games, players who team up and work together will have a better chance at surviving – whether it be in PvP or PvE.

The game takes place four years after a global disaster and players will find themselves dealing not just with other survivors but the infected that have overrun the world. It’s a big world, with a variety of environments. Players will be able to build defenses (and homes) using a free building system with over 1,000 different items, but as with everything else, they’ll need to work together to do it.

test_endpoint.title: Dungeons & Dragons MMORPG Neverwinter Celebrates 10th Anniversary With Special Event
test_endpoint.short_description: Players can participate in special missions and earn exciting rewards, including mounts, costumes, and companions.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Happy 10th Anniversary, Neverwinter!

In celebration of 10 years online, Cryptic Studios' free-to-play Dungeons & Dragons MMORPG is holding an event called Protector's Jubilee. Players can participate in special missions and earn exciting rewards, including mounts, costumes, and companions. One of the rewards is the Elminster Simulacrum, which is voiced by Ed Greenwood, the creator of Forgotten Realms — where the game’s world is set. The event offers revamped content, daily missions, escort missions, and messages from Elminster Aumar.

This update is now live on PC, Xbox, and PlayStation. As for the anniversary event, that will run until June 22 and here’s more details via the official website.

test_endpoint.title: The Savior Update For MapleStory Global Is Now Live, Featuring The New Job Khali And Numerous Exclusive Events
test_endpoint.short_description: Besides fresh content, Nexon has enacted Burning again and also introduced several changes to certain jobs as well as endgame stuff.
test_endpoint.article_content:
We are saved, Maplers.

Nexon has dropped Version 242 — Savior: Khali, Wind of Vengeance — for MapleStory Global. One of the major highlights is the addition of a new job called Khali. She is a Flora character that utilizes LUK as her primary stat. Khali’s primary weapon is Chakram, and her secondary weapon is the Hex Seeker. Unfortunately though, folks must wait until June 28 to start playing as the Wind of Vengeance.

In the meantime however, Wonky the Fairy and his friends are hosting a variety of events at their restaurant, Wongstaurant, from June 14 to August 2. Players can earn rewards by completing story quests, daily, weekly, and season missions, or by purchasing items from the Coin Shop. The Special Menu changes every week, and it features a variety of dishes that can be purchased with Wongstaurant Coins. Some of the rewards include rings, scrolls, and damage skins. These Wongstaurant events are also a way to easily level characters.

Something else that’s happening as of yesterday (until November 14) is yet another Burning event, which allows players to create or use existing characters between Levels 200 and 248 to receive Hyper Burning. These characters level up three levels at a time and receive special rewards alongside progression (up to Level 250). There’s also the Burning World, a unique and time-limited world designed to aid players in leveling up rapidly on top of the Burning effect. It offers various advantages, such as accelerated experience gain, lower monster difficulty, and access to exclusive events and rewards through the Step Up event. Come August 30, the Burning World will go away and then players will have two weeks to transfer up to five characters over Level 150 to non-Reboot worlds through World Leap.

It doesn't stop there too; there’s even more events on the way.

From June 28 to August 29, Khali's Journey will begin. By creating a Khali character, players will earn various rewards at different levels, including a Lil Khali pet package, equipment boxes, titles, symbol selectors, and growth potions. In addition, there’s Khali's Wish, another event where players at Level 101 and above can participate once per account after reaching level 200 on Khali. By defeating enemies near your level and attending for a total of 20 days, players can earn rewards such as rings, damage skins, chairs, emblems, and a Zealot set.

Also, Miracle Time is a 24-hour event that occurs on select days, allowing players to double their chances of ranking up item potentials using Cash Cubes, with different item types being affected on different dates. On the other hand, Sunny Sunday is an event where players at Level 101 and above can log in on specific Sundays to enjoy various perks such as increased experience, double rewards, and discounted enhancements. Lastly, Spell Trace Fever Time is a limited-time event that increases the success rate of equipment upgrades during specific time slots in non-Reboot worlds.

Finally, the Jett Job Advancement will take place during “the second part” of the Savior update, according to Nexon. 

Besides events though, several skill improvements have been made across different jobs. These enhancements aim to balance and refine existing skills, ensuring a more enjoyable and engaging gameplay experience for players, according to Nexon. Additionally, the required EXP to level up in the Level 220 - 259 range has been decreased by various percentages. Moreover, the Arcane River Special Content has become weekly, offering three plays per week, with adjusted EXP rewards and symbol coupons. Furthermore, there are improvements to various aspects such as Monster Park, equipment enhancement, Lachelein, and character stats. There’s plenty of bug fixes too.

Check out the patch notes for more details on all of the information mentioned above.

test_endpoint.title: Final Fantasy XIV Twitter Sweepstakes Giving Away Flying Cumulus Seed Mounts
test_endpoint.short_description: There will be 2,800 winners each month through August.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn is celebrating its upcoming 10th anniversary with giveaways of Flying Cumulus Seeds. They are giving away 2,800 Flying Cumulus Seeds on the 14th of each month between May and August.

To enter you'll need to head over to Twitter and follow the English, French, or German FFXIV accounts, then retweet the "Announcement Post" each month. In your retweet, you'll need to include the hashtag #FFXIV10thSweepstakes, your full in-game character name, and your full in-game Home World name.

You might want to check out the official post on the Final Fantasy XIV site to make sure you get it right, they've got an example template of what it should look like and a few reminders such as making sure your mailbox isn't full in case you win.

Best of luck to those who enter!

test_endpoint.title: Perfect New World Developers Taking Player Feedback From  Exploratory Closed Beta Seriously
test_endpoint.short_description: As they should.
test_endpoint.article_content:
The developers of Eastern Fantasy MMORPG Perfect New World (Yes, yes. We know… We’ve discussed name thing before…) have officially concluded the game’s first Explaoratory Beta Test and have now moved on to the whole reviewing feedback stage of things. According to a post published on Steam today, developer Ironcore Game Studio is taking this feedback seriously. In fact, they’ve already informed players of the optimization that will be taking place.

The post lists twelve things that the developer is currently at work on. These include things like adding more content of various types like gameplay on the world map, map tiles, and class types. They also stated they’re adding a Fair PvP mode – basically dueling. There are also mentions of story-related additions – as well as an addition that will allow players to skip that story. Those interested can find the full list on Steam.

test_endpoint.title: Survive And Extract During Closed Beta For Top-Down Shooter Return Alive
test_endpoint.short_description: Top-down shooter action that looks promising.
test_endpoint.article_content:
In Return Alive, you'll be navigating a post-apocalyptic world shrouded with toxic gas collecting precious resources and technology. This top-down shooter features both PvE and PvP elements during gameplay in two game modes during the upcoming closed beta.

Solo Deathmatch in Return Alive is a 5-minute deathmatch involving 8 players, while the Survival game mode is an escape game with 14 players. To be successful players must craft weapons and augment their character's abilities with rewards acquired throughout the battleground.

The closed beta for Return Alive is scheduled for June 29 through July 7 and players can request access on the official Steam page.

There's a trailer for Return Alive below so you can take a look and see if it's something you're interested in signing up for. It looks like it could be pretty cool.

test_endpoint.title: Build A Thriving Community During Coreborn: Nations Of The Ultracore's Open Beta
test_endpoint.short_description: Community driven survival going free-to-play on launch.
test_endpoint.article_content:
During Steam Next Fest you'll be able to band together and build a thriving community in the Open Beta for the upcoming PvE social survival sandbox game Coreborn: Nations of the Ultracore. You can check out the game from June 19th through the 26th during Steam Next Fest.

Coreborn: Nations of the Ultracore comes from indie developer Blankhans who look to heavily involve the community during the game's Early Access period which begins July 18th. The devs anticipate the game being in Early Access for one to two years.

Build yourself a home, gather materials, craft armor, and take up arms in the PvE world of Tormentosia. Coreborn sounds like it will heavily encourage player interaction and cooperation as the theme of community runs throughout the game's description.

You can check out the Early Access trailer below then sign up for the Open Beta during Steam Next Fest on the Coreborn: Nations of the Ultracore Steam page.

test_endpoint.title: Cozy MMO Palia Holding Server Stress Test July 6, Over 200,000 Expected To Jump In
test_endpoint.short_description: This is their biggest playtest yet.
test_endpoint.article_content:
On July 6, Singularity Six will be hosting a new playtest for their cozy MMO Palia. This will be their third, and “biggest” playtest so far. The objective is to see how the game handles a lot of players. To that end, they’re inviting more than 200,000 players to attend. If you were already part of one of the other tests, your invite is guaranteed. For everyone else, you have some time to sign up. (That means filling out a survey.)

Since this is more or less a server stress test, it won’t be too long. In fact, it’s only going to last for four hours – from 2:00 PM to 6:00 PM Pacific time. Players who didn’t participate in the last Alpha tests will need to sign up soon as invites will be going out over the next two weeks. Once someone receives their invite, it will take them to an account creation page where they can do all the necessary stuff. And yes, this test is under NDA.

test_endpoint.title: Phantasy Star Online 2: New Genesis’s Summer Bash Billboard Ad Might Seem A Bit Familiar To FFXIV Players
test_endpoint.short_description: This one’s official though.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Who remembers the billboard ads for a big RP party in Final Fantasy XIV. The one that featured game characters dressed in summer clothing that wasn’t out yet, but the creators had access to thanks to data mining and mods? Everyone thought Square Enix was going to come crashing down around our heads and this was the end of mods for sure? Was that really all a year ago?

who's gonna go for world first pic.twitter.com/79y1tdDuSq

— 🏳️‍⚧️ yule @ STAR RAIL 🏳️‍⚧️ (@yuleloggu) July 5, 2022

Obviously, that didn’t happen. I mean, we ended up having the whole thing repeat again when the zoom cheat was used to complete The Omega Protocol Ultimate. And the world continues to turn.

But that doesn’t mean the whole thing hasn’t been forgotten about. And it seems that Sega, of all things, decided to have a little fun with it. The company doled out money for billboards in Los Angeles and Dallas for the upcoming Phantasy Star Online 2: New Genesis Summer Bash event. The billboard is obviously intended to promote the game’s new Creative Space feature that doubles both as housing and a place for players to create challenges for each other, but it definitely riffs on the FFXIV billboard of Drama. It’s an interesting choice and it seems like it’s having the desired effect. People are talking about it.

It's a Summer Bash! 🔥🧡☄️
Things are heating up in 'Phantasy Star Online 2 New Genesis ver.2' with the new Creative Space feature!

Los Angeles & Dallas! Keep an 👁️ out for our billboard ad and be sure to snap a pic if you see it! 📸 pic.twitter.com/zfK5a6Kucz

— Phantasy Star Online 2 New Genesis - Global (@play_pso2) June 10, 2023

test_endpoint.title: Wargaming Donates $108,318 To The Victims Of the Kakhovka Hydroelectric Power Plant Destruction
test_endpoint.short_description: The money will help buy new gear and equipment for rescue operations.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Following the recent destruction of the Kakhovka Hydroelectric Power Plant in Ukraine, World of Tanks developer Wargaming announced plans to donate 4 million UAH (or $108,318 USD) via United24. This money is intended to help buy gear and equipment needed to aid in rescue operations in the region. These necessary items include lifeboats and rafts, excavators, bulldozers, firefighting gear, diving suits, and more.

The hope is that the money will assist the volunteers and Ukrainian services that have been working to save people and animals. They also intend for it to help mitigate the issues that follow something like the destruction of a power plant.

test_endpoint.title: Lost Ark's Latest Continent Elgacia Is Available Today For Exploration, Plus A New Abyssal Dungeon And Fortunespire Part II
test_endpoint.short_description: Uncover the secrets of Elgacia, dive into the Kayangel, Light's Sanctuary dungeon, and clear the final Fortunespire floors.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Elgacia, here we come.

Amazon Games has launched the June update for Lost Ark, which introduces the new continent of Elgacia. Players of the MMO-ARPG will uncover the secrets of Elgacia as they embark on new quests, encounter Field Bosses, and discover collectibles scattered throughout the continent. Plus, there’s a cinematic storyline to accompany gameplay.

Furthermore, the update introduces a new end-game Abyssal Dungeon called Kayangel, Light's Sanctuary. This dungeon is designed for a group of four players and can be accessed once the Elgacia story has been completed. There’s also the Balthorr Raid Event, where players have the opportunity to transform into a beer — you heard that right, a beer — and assist others in calming down Balthorr, who has fallen into a drunken and hopeless state. By participating in this event, players can earn event tokens that can be exchanged for various special rewards. 

Another addition is Part II of the Fortunespire, the final 25 floors (26 to 50). Players who are able to conquer the challenges of Fortunespire will receive exclusive first-time clear rewards. Last but not least, there’s plenty of new stuff added to the store for purchase.

Here's the patch notes for more information.

test_endpoint.title: Overwatch 2 Game Director Says Season 6 Is Bigger Than Previous Seasons, And The Story Goes In-Depth... For $15
test_endpoint.short_description: There will indeed be PvE content, just through Story Missions instead of Hero ones.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Is there a glimmer of hope still for PvE in Overwatch 2?

Although the developers at Blizzard recently announced the cancellation of PvE content in the hero shooter through Hero Missions, they didn’t cancel everything. The upcoming Story Missions, set during the invasion of the Null Sector, will be part of the upcoming Season 6: Invasion. These missions take place in Rio de Janeiro, Toronto, and Gothenburg and feature large maps, in-depth storylines, and intense battles against new enemy types like Annihilators and Stalkers. 

"We typically don't go into depth in-game with our stories," game director Aaron Keller told Game Informer. That changes though with the upcoming missions, as they focus on the moment when Overwatch gets back together and answers Winston's recall. 

In Toronto, for example, the player fights off waves of Null Sector grunts and artillery bots to protect an evac ship. New enemy types, such as Stalkers and Subjugators, pose challenges during the mission. According to Game Informer, the gameplay lasts around 31 minutes, showcasing the massive map size and diverse battles. Also, the missions allow for different character interactions and unique story elements based on the selected heroes.

The Story Missions will be released as part of the Overwatch 2: Invasion Bundle, which costs $15 and includes the three missions, a Legendary skin for Sojourn, Overwatch Coins, and access to Sojourn for new players that joined after her inclusion. The Ultimate Invasion Bundle costs $40, however, yet adds the Null Sector Premium Battle Pass, additional skins, and bonuses. Also, there's a bonus co-op mission called "Underworld" set in King's Row, a new PvP mode called Flashpoint, and Hero Mastery missions.

"[Season 6] is definitely bigger," Keller said, in comparison to previous seasons. "We don't want to save up content and save it for these giant releases years down that line; that's what a box release would be for a game.” The team repurposed some of the canceled Hero Missions into other content, and Keller hinted at reusing more of it in the future. This new season, which starts August 10, marks a significant content drop and aims to shift the live-service focus beyond just hero and map releases. The team plans to release more Story Missions and incorporate player feedback for future missions.

Note: Activision Blizzard has been sued by California’s Civil Rights Department, alleging violations of California’s Fair Employment and Housing Act and Equal Pay Act.  CEO Bobby Kotick is alleged to have known about the alleged violations within his company. These allegations have all been denied by Activision Blizzard and the company points to additional diversity and inclusion training as past examples of taking the accusations seriously at the time they were made.

test_endpoint.title: "Land Of The Morning Light", The MMO's Largest Expansion To Date, Is Now Live In Black Desert Online
test_endpoint.short_description: This new region represents authentic Korean culture, says Pearl Abyss.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Welcome to "Land of the Morning Light."

Pearl Abyss has dropped the latest expansion for Black Desert Online, which takes place in a new region inspired by Korea's Joseon period, the last dynastic kingdom. According to the developers, the expansion — which authentically represents Korean culture — offers breathtaking landscapes, intricate architecture, challenging boss battles, and a rich narrative experience with non-linear quest lines. Players can enjoy 80 cutscenes, 40 vignettes, and 6,000 fully-dubbed lines.

In terms of gameplay, "Land of the Morning Light" introduces eight bosses that players must defeat to progress through the narrative. Each boss has unique mechanics and combat strategies. Additionally, a new competitive boss challenge called "Boss Blitz" has been added. After defeating a boss, players can engage in up to 10 customized "Calamity" difficulty levels and compete with others for top rankings organized by character class.

Additionally, the expansion also brings quality-of-life improvements, including powerful gear and specialty items to enhance gameplay. Players can look forward to acquiring items like "Dahn's Gloves," the "Belt of Taebaek," the "Jewel of Illusion," and the "Deboreka Earring." Housing options have also been expanded, providing larger indoor and outdoor social gathering spaces. "Shimhyangje," a spacious manor with generously sized rooms and traditional furniture, is among the new housing structures. Also, the revamped "Panokseon" boat offers a sea-faring experience with combat capabilities and ability to accommodate a large crew.

While the MMORPG's expansion is free for Black Desert Online owners, the base game is something you'd have to buy if you aren't an owner already. However, in celebration of the launch, all game packages will be available at a 50% discount on Steam and through the official website. As for console players, the Woose Awakening update just went live.

test_endpoint.title: Maniac Panda Games Announces Three Game Dates For Outer Ring MMO Early Access Pre-Alpha
test_endpoint.short_description: Mark your calendars, again and again.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Today, Manic Panda Games announced plans to expand on their previously announced Early Access Pre-Alpha for the Outer Ring MMO. If you missed hearing about that one, they initially announced the event would be held on June 28. Rather than cramming everything into that one date, the dev team has decided to add two more. That means two more chances for those who may not get in the first time to join later. These are July 12 and July 26. In the case of the first two, the game will run from 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM CEST. The last event will run 24/7 – which means just rolling into full Early Access at that point.

Keep in mind, this is an NFT game. That means those interested in participating will need a wallet registered with Blink Galaxy. If you want in, you’ll have to create the wallet first and provide some “personal information” along with the address. They’ll also need to either purchase an Outer Ring NFT – via Lootboxes or the in-game marketplace – or have at least 100,000 Galactic Quadrant tokens in their wallet. Effectively, you’re spending money if you want in.

test_endpoint.title: Time Hopping Can Make Things Messy As Star Trek Online Launches "Unraveled" On Consoles
test_endpoint.short_description: Finally, console players can join Admiral Kuumaarke and assist with the conflict with the Tholians.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Okay Star Trek Online console players, today’s the day. You can now hop into the MMORPG’s latest content update, “Unraveled” and join Admiral Kumaarke in her effort to stabilize the Na’kuhl sun. Of course, this won’t go exactly as planned. Remember all that time hopping you’ve been doing.

Of course, someone has something to say about it, and the Tholians are here with a complaint. It turns out time and dimensional travel does have an effect, and now trans dimensional Reality Vortices are causing problems. Guess who’s fault that is? You’re gonna have to help fix it so prepare yourself. You’ve got work to do.

test_endpoint.title: Pretend You Have Rhythm In Newly Announced Headbangers Rhythm Royale
test_endpoint.short_description: It's a rhythm game royale with dancing pigeons.
test_endpoint.article_content:
If you've always wanted to play a dancing pigeon in a game then you're in luck. Headbangers Rhythm Royale was announced during the Future Games Show and it's a rhythm game with a twist. Take on 29 other player-controlled pigeons across four rounds, testing your memory, rhythm, reflexes, and reaction time.

Headbangers Rhythm Royale is fully cross-platform playing on PC, Switch, PS5 and PS4, Xbox One, and Xbox X|S. There are outfits to collect and taunts to rub it in your opponents' faces.

There are 23 different minigames each with their own musical twist. There will be an in-game battle pass and a unique score across each minigame.

Check out the reveal trailer for Headbangers Rhythm Royale and the game's Steam page.

test_endpoint.title: More Content Is Always Nice And Exoprimal Unveils PvE Mode Savage Gauntlet & Exosuit Variants
test_endpoint.short_description: Fight dinosaurs, get rewards, it's that simple.
test_endpoint.article_content:
During the Xbox Games Showcase Extended today, Exoprimal showed off some new content coming to the shooter in the form of Exosuit variants and the PvE game mode Savage Gauntlet.

In Savage Gauntlet, five-player teams take on weekly rotating PvE scenarios that offer a high level of challenge. Leveled-up Exosuits will be needed in these encounters and players will be equipping Module power-ups.

Along with the new game mode comes a list of variant Exosuits. 10 suits with variant powers will be available.

Exoprimal is going into Open Beta Test 2 later this week so you can jump in and check out what's new. The game is scheduled to launch on July 14th.

test_endpoint.title: Power Items Nerfed And Conquest Map Reworked: SMITE Season Of Souls Live Now
test_endpoint.short_description: There's a lot of changes to SMITE in Season of Souls.
test_endpoint.article_content:
The major headline for Season of Souls in Smite is that power items have been nerfed across the board, bringing down the overall damage of carries and helping tanks feel a little tankier, but that's not all. The Conquest map has seen layout and visual tweaks and three new features have been added to the MOBA.

The Conquest map has seen a visual update to a more chilling, darker atmosphere to match the Season of Souls in Smite. The layout has been tweaked with improvements to lane size, jungle paths, and more. The Stygian Tower and Unleashed Titans have been added to Conquest, and Sould Surge has been added to all game modes.

Along with all this comes a new Battle Pass with all new rewards players can earn. It of course features both a free and premium track. Unlock bonuses and skins along the way.

Also added are four color-changing skins that you can customize with the dye of your choice. There's a skin available to purchase for Cthulhu, Ra, and Fenrir, and a Cupid skin you can unlock for free via quests.

Check out the new cinematic trailer for Smite's Season of Souls. You can download and play my favorite MOBA for free.

test_endpoint.title: Return To Voss In Star Wars: The Old Republic’s “Old Wounds” Update
test_endpoint.short_description: Dig deeper into Darth Nul’s past.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Today, Star Wars: The Old Republic returns to Voss in the MMORPG’s latest update. “Old Wounds” has players poking around in Darth Nul’s past in a newly discovered landing zone named Interpreter’s Retreat. This zone is where players will need to go to experience a new Flashpoint, Shrine of Silence.

In Shrine of Silence, players will help a Voss commando rescue two Mystics lost in the Shrine. In payment for their help, players will receive new armor sets and stronghold decorations. The Flashpoint can be played in all modes either solo or in a group. It’s also relevant to Interpreter’s Retreat, but players who want to skip it can do so without issue.

Details on the new content, as well as events and other things, can be found in the announcement on the SWTOR site. There’s also plenty of new gear to oogle while you’re there.

test_endpoint.title: Friends vs Friends Drops New Trailer And Free Content Update
test_endpoint.short_description: A deck building FPS with "Very Positive" reviews on Steam.
test_endpoint.article_content:
There's a lot of new stuff for the frantic FPS deck builder hybrid game "Friends vs Friends" today. The team dropped a brand new trailer for the game and there's also a new content update live now with another on the way soon.

Friends vs Friends is described as a delightfully frantic deck-building FPS and has "Very Positive" reviews on Steam. You can matchmake with players online in 1v1 or 2v2 combat, or host private matches with your friends. In Friends vs Friends, you choose from a cast of characters who each have their own special abilities. Players collect weapon, trap, and curse cards, and level them up.

Today Friends vs Friends released the "Little Liars" update, adding a new skin and five new cards. In early July another free update is coming titled "Baba's Laundromat" and will include 10 new cards, 15 cosmetics, and 5 skins unlocked by completing quests.

Check out the new trailer for Friends vs Friends below, and you can grab the game on Steam for $9.99.

test_endpoint.title: Embracer Group Announces Layoffs As Part Of A Switch In Company Focus, Some Game Studios Could Close
test_endpoint.short_description: They’re moving on from buying up other companies to become a “more focused and self-sufficient company”.
test_endpoint.article_content:
It seems that Embracer Group, the company that spent a lot of time buying out various companies across TV, comic books, and video games including Gearbox and Middle-earth Enterprises, is now done snapping up smaller companies – at least for the time being. According to a letter posted on the company website by its CEO, Embracer is now restructuring to become “a leaner, stronger and a more focused, self-sufficient company”.

That’s more or less a fancy way of saying they’re done the mergers and acquisitions phase and will now begin cutting costs. People are being laid off. At present, the number of people being let go hasn’t been specified, nor has which companies these changes will impact. Although the letter does note that the company currently “engages” around 17,000 people.

These layoffs will probably not all happen at once either. In the letter, the CEO outlines the phases of their plan. These are intended to take place over a period lasting until March 2024. There are three phases in all, two of which start now and seem to be more assessment. The last phase will “focus on internal consolidation, further resource utilization, and more synergies”. Basically, it seems like employees have a bit of time – and some warning – before they start letting people go.

It’s not great news for plans of employed game developers, but it’s also not anything we’re not familiar with. After all, we’ve been watching EA and Activision do this for years.

test_endpoint.title: Second Closed Beta For Upcoming Free-To-Play Shooter THE FINALS Starts Tomorrow
test_endpoint.short_description: Sign up now to experience the changes Embark Studios has made following the first playtest.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Itching for THE FINALS?

Here’s some good news then: Embark Studios is conducting the second Closed Beta for their team-based, free-to-play shooter game. This playtest will be available on Steam from June 14 to the 21st. The developers’ focus of the closed beta is to make improvements based on feedback received from the previous beta, particularly regarding performance, gunplay experience, movement, and more. 

In addition to under-the-hood enhancements, new content such as weapons, cosmetics, skins, and a progression system will be introduced. The game modes have also been modified, with the inclusion of a more casual-friendly variant called Quick Cash, featuring 3v3v3 matches with longer gameplay, faster respawns and extractions, and a single vault. You can sign up right now.

test_endpoint.title: EVE Online's Viridian Expansion Is Now Live, Featuring New Ways To Manage Corporations
test_endpoint.short_description: Players can enact Corporation Projects and AIR Opportunities, as well as utilize the Herald System.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Greener pastures are ahead for EVE Online.

That’s because CCP Games has launched the free Viridian expansion for the free-to-play, sci-fi spacefaring MMO. This major expansion introduces new features to empower player-driven corporations and enhance their success. For example, players can now manage their corporations more effectively with tools like Corporation Projects and the AIR Opportunities interface. The expansion also allows for personalization of Upwell structures through the Heraldry System, giving corporations a unique identity. 

In terms of gameplay, Tech II Lancer Dreadnoughts have been added, offering new strategic options in battles. These ships have disruptive weaponry that can disable certain actions of enemy targets. The expansion also brings visual enhancements to the game, including volumetric cloud designs, improved frigate and marauder lighting, and enhanced missile impact effects. Also, to celebrate the release, players can claim 7 free days of Omega game time, granting them access to premium features.

test_endpoint.title: Ron Gilbert, Creator Of Monkey Island, Was "Unaware" Of The Series' Collaboration With Sea Of Thieves Until Shortly Before The Announcement
test_endpoint.short_description: Sea of Thieves is bringing the world of Monkey Island to the game as a three-part Tall Tale expansion called The Legend of Monkey Island.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Guybrush Threepwood always did want to become a pirate.

In case you missed it, Sea of Thieves, in collaboration with Lucasfilm Games, is bringing the world of Monkey Island to the swashbuckling game as a three-part Tall Tale expansion called The Legend of Monkey Island. The expansion, announced during the recent Xbox Games Showcase, will be released in monthly installments starting from July 20. Players will embark on a brand-new adventure featuring characters and voice actors from the Monkey Island series, including Guybrush Threepwood, Elaine, LeChuck, Murray the Demonic Talking Skull, and more. 

The expansion allows players to freely explore Mêlée Island and Monkey Island, solving puzzles in a point-and-click style adapted for Sea of Thieves' first-person view. The story takes place in the Sea of the Damned, which is separate from the main setting of the base game. 

As per Xbox Wire, the Sea of Thieves team are big fans of Monkey Island. They said the expansion captures the essence of both Monkey Island and Sea of Thieves, providing an immersive experience with in-depth dialogue, iconic puzzle gameplay, and the presence of beloved Monkey Island characters. 

“The idea of what could a potential story be if Guybrush and Elaine found their way into the Sea of Thieves, that was something we thought about during the development of A Pirate’s Life.”

The Legend of Monkey Island adds new locations to Sea of Thieves, allowing players to explore classic areas while introducing new elements. They concluded that the collaboration aims to introduce new players to the Monkey Island franchise while providing an authentic and connected experience for existing fans.

“The double meaning of the ‘legend’ in The Legend of Monkey Island, refers to Guybrush’s “past stories”, and the adventure you will go on in this new Tall Tale in Sea of Thieves.”

That being said, excitement from the team and anticipation from the players aside, Ron Gilbert, the creator of Monkey Island, has revealed through Mastodon that he was not consulted or informed about the series' crossover with Sea of Thieves. The collaboration between Rare and Lucasfilm Games did not involve Terrible Toybox, his company. He directed the first two installments of the Monkey Island series and created the iconic characters being used in the crossover. 

According to Gilbert, he "Wasn't even told about it," and the collaboration "Happened behind my back." Gilbert said, "It was all done without my knowledge or input.” While Gilbert was given a "heads-up" prior to the reveal, Gilbert wasn't given a chance to "meaningfully" contribute, but does wish the game well.

test_endpoint.title: You Asked For It… The Texas Chainsaw Massacre Will Have Crossplay At Launch
test_endpoint.short_description: There won’t be cross progression, however.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Okay. We have some good news and some (potentially) bad news. First, the good news… The Texas Chain Saw Massacre will be launching with crossplay. Sumo dropped a post on the game’s blog today detailing how it would work – specifically, which platforms can matchmake with each other. Anyone with a current-gen system is covered. That means Steam, Windows, Xbox X|S, and PlayStation 5 can all play together. Xbox One and PlayStation 4 players will have to live without matchmaking.

Now, for the (potentially) bad news. It really depends on how much you care about this one, particular feature. There will be no cross-progression. Progress and saves will be tied to the platform the player is on at the time. Sorry guys.

test_endpoint.title: Overwatch 2 Season 5 Takes Us On A Mythic Role-Playing Adventure
test_endpoint.short_description: New adventures, magical skins, and more.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Season 5 in Overwatch 2 is bringing the role-playing vibes with new challenges, game modes, skins, and more as part of a high-fantasy theme. 

Tracer and her friends are setting out on an epic roleplaying adventure called Questwatch, and as you progress through the Season 5 battle pass in Overwatch 2 you will unlock new chapters in their adventure. Also in the Premium battle pass is the Mythic Adventurer skin for Tracer.

Coming to the game is the first-ever creator-made game mode in Overwatch 2 called Defeat the Demon Lord. Four heroes will take on the Demon Lord Reinhardt in a 1v4 team Deathmatch brawl.

Fun is the Sun returns with Lucioball, and a new game mode called Winston's Beach Volleyball. Lucioball is a 3v3 sports game where players work to score with a gigantic soccer ball. Winston's Beach Volleyball will have you running, jumping, and spiking a giant volleyball scoring when the ball hits the sand.

The Overwatch 2 devs are also planning for the Season 5 balance patch, as well as making changes to weekly challenges. On August 4th they'll be unveiling an all-new animated short exclusively in the game client.

There's a ton of content ahead for Overwatch 2 and you can check out the full preview on the official Overwatch 2 site.

Note: Activision Blizzard has been sued by California’s Civil Rights Department, alleging violations of California’s Fair Employment and Housing Act and Equal Pay Act.  CEO Bobby Kotick is alleged to have known about the alleged violations within his company. These allegations have all been denied by Activision Blizzard and the company points to additional diversity and inclusion training as past examples of taking the accusations seriously at the time they were made.

test_endpoint.title: Get A Behind The Scenes Look At Funcom’s Upcoming Dune: Awakening MMO From The PC Gaming Show
test_endpoint.short_description: Yes, it includes gameplay footage.
test_endpoint.article_content:
If you’ve been waiting to find out more about Funcom’s open-world survival MMO Dune: Awakening, then you’re going to want to check out this video from the PC Gaming Show. The thirteen-minute video, posted by PC Gamer, features interviews with Creative Director Joel Bylos and Game Director Viljar Sommerbakk. They discuss the focus of the game, where players start out, and what they can work toward. As this is a survival game, players start out with almost nothing and will have to do everything they can to survive while trying to become a powerful figure in the world.

The video offers players a look at Dune: Awakening’s gameplay, but do keep in mind this is alpha footage. What they’re showing players now could be completely different by the time we hit launch. Still, it gives us an idea of what they’re going for.

As some of you may know, Funcom is one of the many companies under the Tencent umbrella these days. That means that Dune: Awakening is one of the many games under the Tencent “partner company” umbrella that was highlighted at the PC Gaming Show this weekend. Others include Path of Exile 2 – which we wrote about here, Digital Extremes and Airship Syndicate’s Wayfinder (trailer below), Level Infinite and NExT Studios’ free-to-play co-op shooter Synced, and a 60-player battle royale kart racer titled Stampede: Racing Royale (trailer also below).

test_endpoint.title: Redfall Update 1.1 Aims To Make The AI Not As Dumb, The Open World More Dangerous, And Stabilize Things A Bit
test_endpoint.short_description: There's a ton of fixes in Redfall Update 1.1.
test_endpoint.article_content:
The Redfall dev team is hard at work improving the game, and thanks to your feedback they've identified some key areas they need to work on in the vampire shooter. Enemy AI responsiveness, enemy encounter frequency, vampire combat efficiency, and improvements to graphical fidelity top the list.

The Redfall team has increased enemy spawn rates across the world, improved aim down sights visibility, and the ability to move without interruption when performing melee attacks has been added, among other tweaks to the gameplay.

Combat has been improved with the fixing of enemies appearing unresponsive during combat, Cultist and Bellwether enemies have improved reaction times, and the Rook will hunt down all living party members while no longer shooting lightning through roofs and other unexpected situations.

Players in Redfall will now have higher chances of encountering more and varied enemies while exploring the world. Enemies will no longer be shooting you through the fire station walls. Add to this, general improvements to collision detection and asset placement.

Performance and stability in Redfall have seen a pass as well, with the infinite loading screen supposedly gone, and improved lighting and performance in several areas.

These are just the highlights, as there's a long list of smaller changes on the official blog post as well that you can check out.

test_endpoint.title: Ubisoft Forward 2023 Recap Features The Best Thing We've Seen From Skull And Bones, And Much More
test_endpoint.short_description: It's all about Ubisoft today.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Ubisoft Forward 2023 is in the books and there were quite a few multiplayer games covered during the event. Given the amount of delays and other issues Ubisoft has been having lately, they could really use a win, so let's take a look at what they presented.

Skull and Bones is a game we've been following here at MMOBomb for quite some time, and quite frankly it has failed to impress so far. Today may have been the best thing Skull and Bones have produced so far, and it wasn't even gameplay. It was the band Home Free who took the stage and sang a chilling sea shanty about the game. On the gameplay side of things, an open beta is incoming for Skull and Bones and will be running from August 25-28 (as long as there are no more delays of course).

XDefiant was featured pretty early on in the presentation. There will be 14 maps at launch with 5 factions, 24 weapons, and 5 different game modes. The road map is quite ambitious with year 1 adding 4 new factions, 12 new maps, and new weapons along the way.

Brawlhalla is getting a crossover event featuring Master Chief and The Arbiter. They arrive in the game on July 12th.

Speaking of crossovers, Roller Champions (yes, it is still kicking) is getting a Jet Set Radio crossover that I'm sure fans have been asking for. Ride in the new Tokyo-To skatepark with characters Gum and Beat. It's all coming on June 27.

It's time to shred the skatepark in Riders Republic as well. Today they announced that Skating is coming to the game. It's all part of Season 8 which is coming on September 26. There will be new tricks and challenges, exclusive customization, and a new area to show off your mad skills in.

Of course, there were all of the usual 42 versions of Assassin's Creed and whatnot along the way as well, but we cover the multiplayer stuff here at MMOBomb, so that'll wrap it up for our Ubisoft Forward 2023 recap. What was your favorite reveal from the event?

test_endpoint.title: Grinding Gear Games Drops Another Path Of Exile 2 Teaser, Beta Date Announcement Coming At ExileCon
test_endpoint.short_description: Promises "everything there is to know" at ExileCon.
test_endpoint.article_content:
During the PC Gaming Show this weekend, Grinding Gear Games decided to drop a teaser for the upcoming Path of Exile 2. This is in addition to the teaser shown for the ARPG during Summer Game Fest.

Titled Aggorat, the teaser shows a player character fighting its way through a bunch of mobs. There’s no HUD, but the ability effects are definitely there. It all looks very cool.

It seems that what the teaser is really for is to get players excited about ExileCon in July. The event is scheduled for July 28 and 29 and during that time the devs will tell fans “everything there is to know” about the upcoming game. This includes the beta launch date.

In addition to the PoE2 info drop, players will also get details on Path of Exile: Mobile and the 3.22 expansion of the original Path of Exile. Those who can’t attend ExileCon in person don’t need to worry, as the event will be streamed on the Path Of Exile Twitch account.

test_endpoint.title: Final Fantasy Holding NA Crystalline Conflict Regional Championship Quarterfinals This Weekend
test_endpoint.short_description: Sixteen teams will compete for their spot in the semi-finals and a chance for a grand prize of $22,500.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Things are moving along with Final Fantasy XIV’s Crystalline Conflict North American Regional Championship. Several teams have been eliminated and 16 remain to fight it out in the Quarterfinals for a chance to be one of the four teams that move on to the semifinals and hopefully, eventually, be the last team standing. The quarterfinals take place this weekend, June 17 and 18. Those interested can watch the event via Twitch.

The four teams to make it to the MMORPG's Semifinals will compete during the North American Fan Festival in Las Vegas on July 29. This too will be streamed for those who can’t make it to the event live.

By the end of the day, only one team will be named champion and they will walk away with $22,500 – to be split among the members. They’ll also receive a trophy, an in-game achievement, and an in-game title.

The four teams to make it into the semi-finals will also receive an in-game achievement and title – as well as paid invitations to the Fan Festival. If you'd like to keep track of the teams and their progress, all the information can be found on the event's site.

test_endpoint.title: Both Apple And Epic Games Request Reexamination Of Their Antitrust Case
test_endpoint.short_description: Apple argues not enough evidence of harm was provided, while Epic Games argues an unfair precedent was set in the April ruling.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Apple and Epic Games are at each other’s throats again.

As reported by Reuters, both companies have separately filed petitions asking the U.S. Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals to reconsider its April ruling in their antitrust case. They are each requesting an en banc review, meaning an 11-person judge panel would convene instead of the original three-judge panel. These kinds of requests are rare though, with only 12 out of 646 petitions being granted last year.

"The panel compounded its error by affirming a nationwide UCL (California's Unfair Competition Law) injunction in a case brought by an individual, non-representative plaintiff that did not even establish injury to itself, let alone the kind of injury justifying classwide relief," Apple wrote in its petition.

Apple argues that Epic Games did not provide enough evidence of harm caused by its practices, while Epic Games argues that the April ruling in favor of Apple sets an unfair precedent and undermines antitrust laws. In case you were not aware, Apple won its appeal against Epic Games' antitrust lawsuit, despite being  found to be in violation of California's anti-steering law.

"That high bar could perhaps work if the competitive benefits and harms of the walled-garden approach are robustly considered at a final balancing step," Epic Games wrote in its petition. "But it plainly undermines the antitrust laws to adopt a rule where any practice that saves administrative costs is ultimately greenlighted, no matter how exclusionary it is or how much consumer harm it generates."

test_endpoint.title: Tower of Fantasy Is Coming To PS4 And PS5, Plus New Map And Characters Revealed
test_endpoint.short_description: The open world, action RPG is coming to PlayStation this summer.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Tower of Fantasy is coming to PlayStation.

Perfect World Games has announced that the open world, action RPG is coming to PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5 this summer. There will be compatibility for DualSense wireless controllers, including haptic feedback and ray tracing technology for enhanced graphics. Although the game is free-to-play, fans can pre-order the PlayStation version starting June 20 for exclusive cosmetics.

Also, the new "Domain 9" map was revealed. It combines futuristic sci-fi elements with Eastern aesthetics, as well as a diverse and interconnected world that features mountains, the Great Wall, citadels, and floating ships. Additionally, new playable characters were shown off, such as Liu Huo. She’s a stylish girl dressed in a qipao who wields a mechanical ink brush.

Here’s the link to pre-order on the PlayStation store.

According to the Tower of Fantasy PC team, this console version will be independent of the current PC/mobile version, so cross play or cross progression will not be available.

test_endpoint.title: Another Trailer For Deceit 2 Drops Showing The Healer Role As Well As A New Terror And Items
test_endpoint.short_description: The asymmetric horror whodunnit is set to launch later this summer on PlayStation, Xbox, and PC.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Are you ready to conceal the truth?

If you answered yes, then we have good news for you: World Makers has unveiled a new trailer for Deceit 2. The game, built in Unreal Engine 5, is an asymmetric horror whodunnit featuring nine-player social strategic gameplay. In the video, new items are showcased like the clipboard and mask, as well as the addition of the Healer role and a never-before-seen Terror design.

Deceit 2 is set to launch later this summer on PlayStation, Xbox, and PC, with crossplay between PC and console players. The game’s 2017 predecessor, Deceit, has been downloaded 14 million times and reached 17,000 peak concurrent users. Here’s the Steam page for more information.

test_endpoint.title: Top 10 MMO Failures Of All Time
test_endpoint.short_description: These MMOs failed to live up to expectations...
test_endpoint.article_content:
It's always sad to see an MMORPG fail for one reason or another. Sometimes games are just released too early and are buggy messes, and sometimes the player base just doesn't get invested in an MMO. Whatever the cause, the following games failed to meet expectations, and most have gone the way of the dinosaur, though there are a couple still up and running today.

This is our list of the Top 10 Biggest MMO Failures of All Time.

The Matrix Online

The Matrix Online was billed as the sequel to the highly successful film franchise. It promised to immerse players in the world of the Matrix, creating your own super-powered combatant to take on the machines. Instead what we got was an uninspired MMO with little to no redeeming qualities.

Hellgate: London

Hellgate: London had a huge marketing push going into the release, but that didn't stop the game from being a lackluster game that while not terrible, didn't do anything special either. It boasted an odd subscription model and poor customer service. The company began laying off employees within a couple of months of launch before a bank seizure ended the game after just over a year of life. You gotta feel bad for those who bought into the lifetime subscriptions.

Gods And Heroes: Rome Rising

I'd wager there are a fair few of you out there that haven't heard of this one, but I vividly remember playing Gods and Heroes: Rome Rising when the original developer was working on the game, as well as when the second developer picked it up and tried to bring it back to life. Unfortunately, a unique setting couldn't keep this MMO afloat for long under either developer, and it finally died its final death. 

Wildstar

Wildstar had all the hype going into its launch, but its focus on "hardcore" really set it back with the general gaming audience. Add to that the uninspired questing and Wildstar ended up making the switch to free-to-play in an attempt to salvage the game. It became a running joke every year regarding when Wildstar was going to shut down. It finally did, bringing a sigh from its remaining player base.

Warhammer Online: Age of Reckoning

You would think a hugely popular IP like Warhammer would get bring in the players, but Warhammer Online: Age of Reckoning never really found its legs. Originally reviewed quite well, the player base simply drifted off within a couple of years and the game was left barren and lifeless. The heavy focus on PvP did not help it maintain a mainstream audience, and soon Warhammer Online went extinct.

APB: All Points Bulletin

APB tried to be Grand Theft Auto Online before GTA Online ever existed. What players actually got was a buggy mess of a game with poor controls and an uninspired game world. The original APB shut down a year after launch and was eventually picked up by Reloaded Production who re-released the game as a free-to-play title that does still exist today, although it still only garners a "Mixed" review score on Steam.

Star Wars Galaxies

Despite its flaws, Star Wars Galaxies was THE Star Wars game for quite some time. An intricate profession system and player-driven world kept fans engaged and immersed in the Star Wars universe. Then the NGE update happened and killed the game dead. Players left in droves, Sony lost the rights to the Star Wars IP, and Star Wars: The Old Republic happened. It all meant death for Star Wars Galaxies.

Vanguard: Saga of Heroes

Several developers behind the original Everquest were behind the development of Vanguard: Saga of Heroes. There were a ton of races and classes, intricate crafting, boat travel, and much more. Unfortunately, the game's publishing deal with Microsoft fell through. Sony Online Entertainment jumped in and forced the game to release earlier than planned, to the dismay of everyone. As you can imagine it was an incomplete buggy mess on release. They tried free-to-play but it was too late by that point and the game is now gone.

Final Fantasy XIV

Why is one of the most successful MMOs of all time on the list of all-time failures? Well, it's because the original state of Final Fantasy XIV at launch was simply unacceptable to the players and for once the devs listened, rebuilt the game's systems from the ground up, and relaunched the game as A Realm Reborn, which would go on to become the MMORPG juggernaut it is today. So there you go, at least one happy ending on this list of sadness.

Tabula Rasa

Stop me if you've heard this one before. Richard Garriott tried to do something after Ultima Online and it didn't work out. Lawsuits were filed, inner turmoil reigned supreme, and what could have been something unique in the MMORPG genre died a painful death. Tabula Rasa was supposed to be the Sci-fi MMO everyone was waiting for. Instead, it passed into history as one of the biggest MMO failures of all time.

And that's our list of the Top MMO Failures of all time. Is there an MMO failure that breaks your heart or that you just find funny? Let us know in the comments below.

test_endpoint.title: The SMITE Season Of Souls Soundtrack Is Actually A Banger
test_endpoint.short_description: Do the kids still say banger?
test_endpoint.article_content:
The Smite Season of Souls update is bringing big changes to the game. The conquest map is being updated, most power items are getting nerfed alongside some of the more meta gods in the rotation. There are buffs to plenty of other gods to go along with that, and the power nerfs should mean a passive buff for tanks in the game.

There will be a new Season Pass and plenty of new skins to collect as well, but what caught my attention today was the soundtrack video Titan Forge Games released today for the Smite Season of Souls. It's honestly sick AF. I'm listening to it now as I type this. Heavy metal tunes rock out in my earholes and my happiness levels are going up and up.

Check out the soundtrack below if you're even slightly a metalhead. I think you'll like what you hear. I'm not usually one to have the music on in Smite, but I'll make an exception once this soundtrack hits the game.

test_endpoint.title: Summer Game Fest: Evercore Heroes Reveals New Support Hero, Clementine
test_endpoint.short_description: Things are heating up in the kitchen.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Evercore Heroes’ next hero is one that truly belongs in the kitchen – or at least needs to bring the kitchen with her. Clementine is a support hero that uses “magical fusion cooking” to aid her allies in combat. She comes with a self-frying pan – which apparently means she has no need of a stove to cook on to get the job done. Good thing, really. Who wants to drag a stove around in combat.

Clementine was revealed in a video earlier today as part of Summer Game Fest along with two other heroes, the Chaos Mage Sydian and the Weather Mage Sky. Don’t let Sydian’s Chaos Mage title fool you. He’s actually a tank. Just… Apparently, one that likes to do his job from a distance. Sky makes use of water and lightning abilities in combat. Not at the same time though… That would probably be bad for her.

For Clementine’s part, she’ll be doing her cooking on the battlefield, with players picking three ingredients to cook together and create a dish that provides benefits in combat. Players will need to cook the food properly – it can be over or under-done – and do it all while dodging attacks and beating up the enemy with their frying pan. Note that improperly cooked food will not provide the same buffs as food that’s done right.

test_endpoint.title: Neverwinter Celebrates 10-Year Anniversary With Protector's Jubilee Event
test_endpoint.short_description: Anniversary events are coming to Neverwinter.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Celebrate 10 years of Neverwinter beginning June 15th with the Protector's Jubilee Event. The event runs through June 22nd and brings plenty of daily tasks, skirmishes, and more to do.

You can help set up for the party by completing daily tasks of placing decorations. These daily tasks will run the length of the Protector's Event. You can also deliver messages to the Harper agents scattered across the Sword Coast who will grant you Protector's Figurines that can be spent in the event store. 

The Protector's Speech is a scaling skirmish event in which you must prevent dissidents from interrupting Lord Neverember's speech. The skirmish has been updated this year with all new foes.

There are escort missions to complete, and guilds will find traveling merchants arriving at their Strongholds.

There are a ton of rewards to earn by partaking in the Neverwinter Protector's Jubilee Event. You can see the full list of rewards on the official Neverwinter site.

test_endpoint.title: LCS 2023 Season To Resume As Players and Riot Reach Concession On Strike
test_endpoint.short_description: It’s not everything the players were shooting for, but it’s a start.
test_endpoint.article_content:
A bit over a week since League of Legends pro players staged a walkout to protest Riot’s changes to the NACL, the company and the LCSPA have announced a compromise has been reached. This means a return to the tournaments for the LCS players on June 14 – with changes made in the schedule to accommodate for the delay.

Both parties posted official announcements detailing the terms of their concessions. As the LCSPA post points out, the terms don’t quite address all the issues, but they go a way to guaranteeing Riot’s support for a new format of the NACL and its players. The organization will receive improved financial support, and players will receive a bit more protection. Among the agreed-upon terms is $300,000 to be split between the 10 NACL teams during the remainder of the 2023 season, sharing 50% of all future NACL sponsorship with NACL teams, requiring teams to meet minimum standards in order to receive payments from Riot, a minimum of 30 days’ severance pay for those earning 1.5 times the league’s minimum salary, and shared representation on a committee to allow players to help decide on any future changes.

According to the LCSPA’s letter, they remain committed to their goal of addressing the impact Riot’s decision has already had on NACL players. This is just a step in the right direction.

test_endpoint.title: ArcheAge Summer Update To Introduce New Daru Transformation Skill
test_endpoint.short_description: Also, get ready for 10v10 time wars.
test_endpoint.article_content:
On June 22, the ArcheAge Summer update will hit, bringing with it an all-new transformation. The new Daru transformation skill opens up a bunch of new abilities to players, including increased movement while riding a donkey mount, the ability to breathe underwater, and a 20% swim speed boost – among others. It all sounds pretty useful, but there is a catch. Transforming into Daru means you’re less equipped for fighting. These little guys aren’t really big on combat. They’re here to explore, gather, mine, farm, and the like. So, maybe avoid the PvP.

Speaking of which… 10v10 time wars anyone? There are no factions in this fight. It’s all about the flags. Players are split into groups by flag color and must collect these flags as they appear and take them back to the base. The first team to hit the 250-point mark wins.

Another important thing hitting this month is the “Make a Splash” global arena beta service. Players from Korea, Asia, North America, and Europe will be able to create teams and participate in arena events. Remember, this is a test. Once it’s over, the devs will take the information back and make improvements.

test_endpoint.title: Epic Games Reveals Fortnite Chapter 4 Season 3: "Wilds" — Featuring The Jungle And Optimus Prime
test_endpoint.short_description: Players will get to earn new cosmetics and weapons, as always, but in a tropical, overgrown location.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Fortnite is about to get wild.

Epic Games is launching the next season of the battle royale game, called "Wilds," which introduces a jungle theme to the game. Chapter 4 Season 3 brings new cosmetics, weapons, and locations for players to explore. 

Adventure awaits in a world below!

Get ready for #FortniteWILDS. Tomorrow. pic.twitter.com/S7yvOQ0CQZ

— Fortnite (@FortniteGame) June 8, 2023

In a trailer, the company showcased the Battle Pass Outfits and the legendary Autobot Optimus Prime in the season's Battle Pass. An official gameplay trailer is scheduled to release today too, alongside a new patch.

test_endpoint.title: "This Week In Destiny" Reveals Community Fashion Contest, Plus Upcoming Grandmaster Nightfalls And Supremacy Mode
test_endpoint.short_description: In case you missed it, by the way, “This Week At Bungie” has been retired.
test_endpoint.article_content:
“This Week At Bungie” is no more.

That’s because Bungie is rebranding their weekly check-in with the community to "This Week In Destiny" (TWID), since they pretty much just focus on the action/shooter MMO anyways. Also, this change was made as the company announced a new game recently: Marathon. Therefore, going forward the weekly Destiny blog will now be announced on official Destiny social channels, though Bungie will also occasionally release standalone blogs.

Anyways, there will be a Community Fashion Contest happening to celebrate the Season of the Deep. Guardians are encouraged to showcase their best fashion combinations using five pieces of armor and share them with the hashtag #DrownInTheDrip. The incentive is a chance to earn the exclusive Prêt-à-porter fashion emblem, and the deadline for submissions is June 15.

Moreover, the Grandmaster Nightfalls will be available earlier than usual during the Season of the Deep. Starting on Week 4, players will have the opportunity to earn Exotic materials and Adept weapons. However, the Conqueror gilding node will open in Week 7. The Wendigo GL3 Heavy Grenade Launcher, Loaded Question Fusion Rifle, and Braytech Osprey Rocket Launcher will be featured in the coming weeks.

The Crucible game mode Supremacy, which involves collecting crests dropped by enemies and denying the enemy points by picking up fallen ally crests, will be added to the Relentless rotator next week. Players can earn ranks and have a chance to obtain Randy's Throwing Knife Kinetic Scout Rifle from Shaxx's loot pool.

Aside from all that, Bungie acknowledged the popularity of the Last Wish raid during the first week of the Season of the Deep. Players spent a total of 2.17 million hours in the raid, surpassing the activity's launch week in 2018.

Here’s the full post for more information, including some fixes.

test_endpoint.title: Capcom To Showcase Upcoming Games, Including Exoprimal, During Event On June 12
test_endpoint.short_description: Dragon's Dogma 2, Exoprimal, and Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective will be featured.
test_endpoint.article_content:
Capcom’s upcoming games will be shown off real soon.

The company has announced that Dragon's Dogma 2, Exoprimal, and Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective will be featured in the upcoming Capcom Showcase 2023. The showcase, which will last approximately 36 minutes, is scheduled for Monday, June 12. Dragon's Dogma 2 is currently in development, while Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective is set to release on June 30 and Exoprimal will launch on July 14.

The Capcom Showcase airs next Monday, June 12 at 3pm PDT! Look forward to new looks at Dragon's Dogma 2, Exoprimal, Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective, as well as a few other updates!https://t.co/uLbZaxVfEu#CapcomShowcase pic.twitter.com/VTadH0Ia3I

— Capcom USA (@CapcomUSA_) June 8, 2023

Also, in case you missed it, Capcom announced a special crossover between Exoprimal and Street Fighter 6 during Summer Game Fest 2023. Ryu and Guile will battle against dinosaurs, featuring both fighters in Exosuit skins that players can equip in Exoprimal. The crossover will also include other Street Fighter-themed cosmetic items for players to use in the game, and more crossovers between Exoprimal and other Capcom titles are planned for the future.

From the Fighting Grounds to the war games, Exoprimal x Street Fighter 6 customizations have been authorized for deployment in fall 2023.
Reminder: Exofighters never back down. pic.twitter.com/rlXTBdW4BQ

— Exoprimal (@exoprimal) June 9, 2023

test_endpoint.title: Palworld Drops Early Access Trailer (And New Access Date Window) At Summer Game Fest
test_endpoint.short_description: A new date has been provided as well.
test_endpoint.article_content:
No matter how much Palworld may remind us of Pokemon, it seems like Nintendo and the Pokemon Company aren’t all that bothered by it. If they were, it would seem unlikely that Pockepair would be dropping a new trailer at Summer Game Fest today. But they did. And it has pretty much everything you’d expect after having seen previous trailers for the game.

It also has something you probably wouldn’t have expected, a new Early Access launch window. No, you won’t be getting your hands on the game this year. Rather, it will launch on Steam Early Access sometime in January 2024.

That might be a disappointment to those of you who were looking forward to running your own gunbunckle sweatshops, but Pockepair assures players the decision was made so they could “deliver the best experience possible, combining survival, crafting, monster catching and breeding into one exciting game in the best possible condition”. Effectively, the game needs more time to cook. Still, time passes quickly, so unless early access is rescheduled again, you’ll be playing before you know it.

test_endpoint.title: Chronicles of Eidola

test_endpoint.title: Therian Saga

Therian Saga is not your typical role-playing game, this browser MMORPG, published by Gameforge AG, offers turn-based combat, a complex crafting system, a task-based queue system and Dungeons and Dragons-inspired dungeon crawling.

test_endpoint.title: Dragon Awaken

Play as one of the anime's popular characters, such as Naruto Umuzaki or Sakura Haruno -- voiced by their anime actors -- to relive the anime or choose one of five characters representing the element of earth, water, fire, wind, or lightning and embark on your own adventures!

test_endpoint.short_description: Explore the world of the popular anime Sword Art Online in SAO's Legend, a free-to-play browser MMORPG from GameSprite.me. test_endpoint.short_description: Set in the distant future, when humanity is on the brink of extinction, StarBreak is a free-to-play platformer MMO with loads of exploration and fast-paced combat. test_endpoint.title: AdventureQuest 3D
